items.question: How much income is tax-free under the new regime?
items.answer: Income up to ₹12 lakhs is effectively tax-free due to the enhanced rebate under Section 87A. For salaried individuals, with ₹75,000 standard deduction, the effective tax-free income becomes ₹12.75 lakhs.

items.question: What is the fiscal deficit target?
items.answer: The fiscal deficit target for FY 2026-27 is 4.3% of GDP, continuing the path of fiscal consolidation from 4.5% in FY 2025-26.

items.question: Is the old tax regime still available?
items.answer: Yes, the old tax regime with deductions under 80C, 80D, HRA, etc. continues to be available. However, the new regime is now the default option.

items.question: Why did the stock market crash after budget?
items.answer: The STT hike on futures and options trading triggered a sharp selloff. ₹6 lakh crore was wiped out as the government signaled intent to curb speculative F&O trading where 93% of retail traders lose money.

items.question: When do new tax rates come into effect?
items.answer: The new tax rates and slabs come into effect from April 1, 2026, the beginning of Financial Year 2026-27 (Assessment Year 2027-28).
